intro: Muellera crucisrubierae, commonly known as the Cross-ribbed Muellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive glandular structure. Muellera crucisrubierae is often found in moist, shaded habitats at higher elevations.
